As agriculture is the only source of income for Artak, he would like to enlarge his business. He has requested this loan to purchase 4 oxen and forage for feeding them. This will enable Artak to gather more income and with increased income he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 4 oxen and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Juana Doribel

texts.es: Juana Doribel soltera, ella es originaria de Chinandega lugar ubicado en la zona del occidente del país. Juana es una mujer trabajadora, muy luchadora en la vida, desde muy pequeña ella comienza a trabajar para así ayudar en los gastos de su familia, lamentablemente ella no puedo cursar una carrera el cual ese era uno de sus sueños pero con mucho empeño termina su secundaria, Juana es propietaria de una pulpería la cual está ubicada en su casa de domicilio, negocio  que consisten en vender productos de consumo diario del hogar en cantidades pequeñas como una bolsita de café, bolsita de champo, bolsita de detergente un jabón de lavar ropa, pasta dental, una libra de arroz, ¼ de aceite, productos congelados, refrescos, entre otros productos más ella compra en distribuidoras que la visitan y les ofrecen sus productos, Juana desde muy temprano se levanta y abre su negocio para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes fijos y eventuales y cierra muy tarde, ella trabaja unas 10 horas diarias, sus clientes ha ido incrementando debido a la calidad de sus productos y la buena atención  de su parte Asia ellos, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro cercano aumentar sus ingresos. Juana Doribel  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Juana Doribel is single and originally from Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. She is a hardworking woman who is a fighter in life. She started to work when she was very young to help her parents with the family expenses. Unfortunately, she was unable to study at university, which was one of her dreams, but with plenty of effort she finished secondary school. 

Juana owns a small grocery store, which is located in her home. Her business consists of selling everyday consumer goods in small quantities, such as packets of coffee, shampoo, or soap for washing clothing, toothpaste, a pound of rice, a quarter of oil, frozen products, and soft drinks, among other products. She buys her products from distributors who visit her and offer their products.

Juana wakes up very early to open her business so that she can better attend her regular and potential clients. She closes very late at night. She works for about ten hours per day. Her clientele has been increasing due to the quality of her products and her good customer service. 

She has applied for a loan to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store in order to offer a better service to her clients. In the near future, she would like to increase her earnings. Juana Doribel is grateful for the help which the Kiva lenders offer to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, salt, peppers, candy, detergent, and frozen products, among others.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto soltero de 44 años de edad, cuatro hijos todos independientes, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega Ubicado el Este del Occidente del país, zona donde es conocida por la producción de la caña y azúcar, comercios, ron entre otros, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de productos de medicina natural como: linaza, gordolobo, miel de palo, bololo, limpia Colom, edraelix, laurel, pomadas, vitaminas, inyecciones entre otros productos, negocio el cual está ubicado en su casa y de manera ambulante, con los créditos anteriores ha ido incrementando sus utilidades y su clientela el cual tiene ya ocho años de dedicarse a este negocio, el compra una vez al mes materia prima donde las realiza fuera del país y aquí, el realiza las compras al contado y vende al crédito y decontado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales en diferentes municipios del país el deja su mercadería y cuando vuelve a ir cobra y deja nueva mercadería, su clientela sabe de la calidad de productos que el ofrece muy cómodamente a sus ingresos, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima compra de  productos como: linazas, gordolobos, miel de palo, bololo vasos plásticos, pomadas, sábila, entre otros productos más. Juan está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kivas por la ayuda que ellos les brinda  a personas de bajos recursos económicos y así tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is single and 44 years old. His four children are all independent. He is from a municipality in Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. This region is well-known for its production of sugarcane, its shops, and its rum, among others. 

He makes a living by producing and selling natural medicines, such as linseed oil, mullein, tree honey, colon cleaners, English ivy, laurel, pomades, vitamins, and injections, among other products. His business is located in his home, and he also sells products as a traveling salesman. 

With his previous loans, he has been increasing his utilities and his clientele. He has been in this business for eight years. He makes his purchases once per month, both abroad and in his country. He makes his purchases in cash and sells on credit or in cash. His has regular and occasional clients in various municipalities in the country. He leaves his merchandise with them and when he comes back, he collects payments and leaves clients with new merchandise. His clientele knows that his products are of good quality and friendly to their income. 

He will use this loan to buy raw materials such as linseeds, mullein, tree honey, plastic vases, pomades, aloe vera, and other products. Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help that they give people with limited financial resources, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as linseeds, mullein, tree honey, plastic vases, pomades, aloe vera, and other products.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es:
La  joven Johanna  de 23 años de edad es soltera, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no tiene casa propia, vive con sus padres.
Johanna se dedica desde hace un año y medio  a la venta de detergentes de todas las clases, también vende ropa interior y sandia, su venta es en la parte de afuera de un  mercado San Lorenzo. 
Johanna sus clientes son las personas que a diario le visitan para comprar sus productos.
Johanna está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de cloro, jabones, detergentes, pastes, etc. tiene bastante demanda de estos productos es por tal razón que solicita a  se le pueda apoyar.
Johanna espera que con la inversión que realice su condición económica mejore un poco al tener mas variedad de productos que ofrecer.
Johanna su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Young Johanna, 23 years old, is single. She does not have dependent children and lives in the town of San Lorenzo, in Valle, in the south of Honduras. She does not own a home, but lives with her parents.

For the past year and a half, Johanna has made a living selling all kinds of detergents. She also sells underwear and sandals. She makes her sales outside of a market in San Lorenzo. Her customers are people who buy products from her every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase chlorine, soap, detergents, pastes, etc. She has enough demand for these products, consequently she is asking for this support.

Johanna hopes this investment will enable her to improve her economic situation a little since she will have a greater variety of products to sell.

Her dream is to have a larger business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2013

loans.use: to purchase chlorine, soap, detergents, pastes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lidia Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia de 38 años de edad es casada,  tiene dos  hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio de venta de comida y golosinas.
Doña Lidia sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos que visitan su negocio, también entrega comida a las cooperativas y bancos de la zona, es una mujer trabajadora que desea superarse.
Doña Lidia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de papas, papaste, yuca, plátanos, sal, cebolla, chile verde,  carnes, etc. que son la materia prima para elaborar sus comidas y golosinas.
Doña Lidia también quiere comprar pescado seco para hacer sopas de pescado ya que sus clientes le piden bastante para esta época de semana santa, con el apoyo de este crédito  espera poder suplir su necesidad de financiamiento, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Lidia su sueño es tener un buen negocio de comidas.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Lidia is a 38-year old married woman who has two dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, located in the South of Honduras, has her own house and makes a living from selling food and candy, a business that she has had for four years now. Her clients are friends and neighbors that visit her store, but she also delivers food to cooperatives and banks in the area. She is a hard-working woman who wants to surpass herself. 

Doña Lidia is requesting a loan to buy potatoes, "pataste" (a zucchini-like vegetable), yucca, bananas, salt, onions, green chili, meat, etc., which are the raw materials she uses to make her dishes and candy. She also wants to buy dry fish to make fish soups, something that her clients are asking for, especially during Easter Week. Thanks to this loan, she expects to cover her financial needs and to reach her dream of having a good meals business. She is very happy to continue to work with Prisma.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013

loans.use: to buy potatoes, "pataste" (zucchini-like vegetable), yucca, bananas, salt, onions, green chili, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina runs a farm where she houses 10 chickens. She also owns a plot of land where she cultivates potatoes and onions and grows cherry trees. She works hard to gather a good harvest and earns income by selling the harvested items at the local market. 

Realizing that agriculture is the only source of her income, Nina has applied to SEF International for a loan. With the loan's help, Nina will be able to purchase fertilizers and onion seeds as well as fuel to transport her agricultural products to the market. 

The loan is very important to Nina because it will enable her to increase her agricultural activity and earn more income. This is vital for sustaining her family of seven, including her husband and his parents as well as their three children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and onion seeds as well as fuel to transport her agricultural products to the market.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane has been involved in agriculture for 10 years. She owns a plot of land where she grows apricots, peaches, cherries, plums, nuts, apples and pears with great love and care. Gayane and her husband work hard to gather a good harvest and be able to cover the family's basic costs. 

Since agriculture is the main source of Gayane's income, unfortunately it is very difficult for her to sustain the family of four, including her husband and her parents-in-law who are retired.

To be financially more secure and to ensure a stable income for her family, Gayane has requested a loan from SEF International. With the loan's help, Gayane will renovate her greenhouse and buy fertilizers. 

The loan is very important to Gayane because it will enable her to renovate her greenhouse as well as cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables throughout the year.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her greenhouse and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. 

To help improve their living conditions, after the state of the economy worsened and affected her husband work, Salam started to sell clothing items to add another source of income. 

Doing that has helped sustain good living conditions. She is now applying for a loan to enhance her business and obtain a new collection of clothes.

loans.use: to obtain a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 60 años de edad ,esta casada y vive junto a su esposoen su casa propia. Sus hijos son independientes quienes  viven en lugares distintos, y la visitan de vez en cuando.El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de comida regional como son los juanes , el tacacho , entre otros . Este trabajo lo realiza  en el frontis de su hogar. En este tiempo se dedica sola a este negocio, compra en las mañanas sus ingredientes que son arroz, pescado, plátano, hojas. Lleva  10 años  en este trabajo. Se inicio en este negocio por  la  falta de dinero y por no encontrar empleo. Tomo la decisión  de realizar está  actividad económica por la gran demanda que tiene. En el futuro desea construir un local para dar mejor atención a sus clientes.Este será su préstamo número 04 con Kiva y esta muy agradecida por brindarle la oportunidad de obtener capital para iniciar su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará arroz, pescado, hojas, plátano, condimentos, utensilios,  entre otros;  Para   preparar sus deliciosas comidas y sus clientes estén satisfechos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old, married and lives with her husband in a home of her own.  Her children are on their own, have their own places, and visit her now and then.  Rosa sells regional food such as “juanes, el tacaco” and other things.  Now she only has this business and buys her ingredients -rice, fish, and plantain leaves- in the morning.  She’s been doing this for ten years and began the business due to lack of money and work.  She decided to do this because of the high demand.  She wants to build a restaurant in the future so that she can give better attention to her customers.  This will be her forth loan through Kiva and she is very grateful for the opportunity to obtain capital to start her business.

She will use the 1,000 PEN from this loan to buy rice, fish, plantain leaves, condiments, utensils, and other things to prepare her delicious dishes so that her customers will be satisfied.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: Adelayda 41 año de edad casada con dos hijos una aun estudiando y está bajo su cargo, ella es originaria de un municipio del Norte de  Chinandega  ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que es muy productiva donde predomina varios tipos de negocios como la ganadería, agricultura, minas de oro, comercios, entre otros,  Adelayda se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora con muchas ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no puedo cursar sus estudios debido  a que ella viene de una familia muy pobre lo único que pudo aprender es a leer,  ella desde temprana edad tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar porque tenía hermanos más pequeños que ella, ella lucha día a día para salir adelante y brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija que tiene a  cargo. Adelayda es propietaria de una pulpería en donde se vende todo tipo de producto de consumo diario como granos básicos, golosinas, aceite , arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan, leche, productos congelados, huevos, sal, detergentes, salsas de tomates, ella desde muy temprano abre su negocio y cierra bien tarde para brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes, negocio que tiene ya 18 años de tener esta pulpería que inicia con sus ahorros, uno de sus sueños es ver terminar los estudios de su hija hasta ser una profesional y que su negocio crezca un poco más ella está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: granos básicos, productos congelados, golosinas entre otros. Adelayda está muy agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda que ellos les brindan a personas de escasos recursos económicos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Adelayda, 41, is married with two children, one of whom is still studying and is under her responsibility. She is originally from a municipality in the north of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. This region is very fertile, and its main industries are livestock, agriculture, gold mines, and commerce, among others.

Adelayda is a responsible and hardworking woman with a desire to continue improving. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she could not study. She is from a very poor family, and she was only able to learn to read. From an early age, she had to work to help with the home expenses because she had younger brothers. She fights every day to succeed and give a better future to her daughter who is under her responsibility. 

Adelayda owns a small grocery store where she sells all types of daily consumer goods, such as basic grains, candy, oil, rice, sugar, beans, bread, milk, frozen products, eggs, salt, detergent, and tomato sauce. She opens her business in the early morning and closes quite late at night to offer a better service to her clients. She opened this business 18 years ago with her own savings. One of her dreams is to see her daughter finish her studies, so that she can become a professional. She would also like her business to grow a bit more. 

She has applied for a loan to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying consumer goods such as basic grains, frozen products, and candy, among others. Adelayda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help which they offer to people with limited resources so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store by buying basic grains, frozen products, candy, and vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Ne'mat

texts.en:
Ne’mat is a 57-year-old woman. She is a mother to eight sons and daughters. 

They have been living off her husband's retirement salary for a while, but she felt that they needed to have a small business to gain more income for the family and make better use of their free time rather than doing nothing. 

So she opened a small food market under their apartment, where she sells basic food products and some snacks. 

She is now applying for a loan to obtain more food products for the store and sell a greater variety.

loans.use: to obtain more food products

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 36-year-old father of three. 

He has a mini-market, where he sells some basic food products, snacks and other stuff. 

He is applying for a loan to redecorate his small shop, so it can accommodate as many goods as possible.

loans.use: to redecorate his small shop

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Doña rosa de 58 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 13 años su principal siembra son los granos básicos maíz y frijol y también cosecha pipianes y ayotes ella vende sus productos con los comerciates que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Doña rosa solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas y foliares así como muestra la fotografía  y poder seguir con sus cosechas para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposo
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old and lives with her husband in a home of her own.  She farms and has been raising basic grains -corn and beans- for 13 years.  She also raises pipanes and pumpkins and sells her products to the merchants near her home.  She and her husband are able to cover the household expenses with the proceeds from the sale of her harvests and with help from her husband.

Rosa is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy compost, pesticides, herbicides, and foliage as is shown in the photograph, so that she can continue with her harvests, have better earnings, and have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer casada de 58 años de edad que de su matrimonio tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo una hija vive con ella y ayuda con algunas actividades en el hogar como la limpieza y otros que a diario se presentan. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que su familia es de bajos recursos y no pudieron apoyarla. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora y agradece a DIOS diariamente porque le permite estar con vida y con muchas fuerzas para salir adelante. En la actualidad ella no esta con su pareja en familia y por lo mismo decidió ver mas halla y crear nuevas opciones de ingreso para su familia. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de elaboración de tortillas pero su fuerte es la agricultura actividad inculcada por su esposo hace mas de 10 años la cual ha sido y es en la actualidad medio de ingreso para su familia.

Catalina está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de fumigación para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya enfermedad que afecta especial mente esta clase de cultivo. 
 
Ella sueña con educar a su hija para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y con tanta contaminación ambiental y la falta de materiales para el cuido, las ganancias que quedan son pocas, pero de esta forma ella podrá preparar y fortalecer su cultivo y tener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Catalina is 58 years old, married, and has eight children but only one of her daughters still lives with her and helps her with the housework, such as cleaning and other daily chores that come up.  She does not have a formal education because her family had limited resources and they were not able to support her.  She is a hardworking, enterprising, lady who thanks God every day because he allows her to be alive and gives her the strength to get ahead.  She is no longer with her husband but she decided to look ahead and create more opportunities for a family income.  She has a small business where she makes tortillas but her strongest business is farming, started by her husband more than ten years ago and currently provides half of the family income.

Catalina is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer, compost, and bug bombs to maintain her coffee crop.  If she doesn’t maintain it, then it can be damaged by diseases that affect this type of crop.

She dreams of an education for her daughter so that she can have a better quality of life and better opportunities for employment because working the land is hard work and with so much environmental pollution and lack of supplies, earnings are low.  However she can prepare and strengthen her crop in this way and have an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Efrain Antonio

texts.es: Don Efrain de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 5 hijos el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas para su cosecha como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, pesticidas, entre otras cosas asi como muestra la fotografia ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi don Efrain pueda tener mejores cosecha que le dejaran buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Efrain is 54 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and five children.  He has been a farmer for several years and his main crop is corn.  He’s able to pay the household expenses from the money he earns from the sale of his harvest.  He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man and is asking for a loan so he can buy farming supplies such as compost, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, pesticides, and other things as is shown in the photograph.  What he currently earns is not enough to cover those costs.  In this way Efrain will be able to have a better harvest which will provide better earnings and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, solicita de un nuevo crédito para surtir el negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos para aportar a su familia. Este le permitirá comprar aretes, pulseras, cadenas, anillos, entre otro, todo de oro y enchape. 
El préstamo anterior le ha permitido generar ingresos. Las  circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que está estudiando una hija,  le brinda ayuda para que se prepare académicamente y también aporta con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is asking for a new loan so that she can stock her business and increase her income to support her family.  This will allow her to buy artifacts, bracelets, chains, rings, and other gold and silver items.

The previous loan allowed her to generate income and the family financial circumstances have improved.  One of her daughters is in school now and [Elizabeth] is helping her prepare academically and pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Isabel

texts.es:
El señor José de 44  años de edad, tiene 02 hijos que dependen de él, vive con su esposa, en casa propia, vive en una comunidad se San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don José se dedica desde hace 05 años  al negocio de venta de ropa nueva, visita las aldeas en bus y a pie, los fines de semana dobla su esfuerzo ya que muy temprano se levanta a destazar cerdos.
Don José con la ayuda de su esposa vende el producto a sus clientes en pulpería y casas donde le compran este producto, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, camisas, calzonetas, etc. 
Don José con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su negocio porque si tiene más mercadería tendrá mejor opciones que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Don José  está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es tener un carro para trasladarse a los caseríos más largos a vender sus productos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Sr. José, 44 years old, has two children who are dependent on him. He lives with his wife in his own house in the town of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. For the past five years he has been selling new clothing. He visits villages by bus and on foot. On weekends he doubles his efforts because he gets up very early to butcher pigs.

With the help of his wife Don José sells his product to customers in small stores and homes. He is requesting a loan to purchase skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, shirts, swim suits, etc. With the help of this loan, Don José hopes to improve his earnings and also his business because if he has more merchandise, he will have better choices to offer his customers.

Don José is very happy to continue working with Prisma. His dream is to own a car to travel in to larger villages in order to sell his products. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2013

loans.use: to purchase skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, shirts, swim suits, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Hnaberd village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and 18-year-old son and, jointly with them, is involved in agriculture. 

They keep a cow, six chickens, cultivate corn and grow peach and apricot trees. The family milks the cow to make dairy products. Karine's husband and son take the dairy products and harvest to the market and sell it locally.

As the agricultural business helps the family to have a stable income and cover its basic costs, Karine would like to enlarge it. She has requested a loan from SEF International to purchase piglets. She plans to raise and sell them. 

The loan is very important for Karine to be able to increase her agricultural income and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for piglets

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush is from Dimitrov village in the Ararat region. She is an assistant at local clinic, and has also been involved in agriculture for 12 years. She keeps 30 chickens, and grows tomatoes and apple trees. Anush works hard to ensure a good harvest and sustain her family of five: herself, her husband, her parents-in-law and her four-year-old son. The whole family helps her sell her products locally and generate income which is vital for the family. Because the family has a hard time covering its daily costs, she lacks sufficient funds to invest in her farm. She has applied for this loan from SEF International to buy fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse. This will allow her to cultivate more fruits and vegetables and significantly increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Araqsya

texts.en: Araqsya has been a beekeeper for five years. She keeps 25 colonies of bees and sells their honey to people who live in her area. Because of her hard work and kindly attitude toward customers, she has many loyal buyers who prefer to get their honey only from Araqsya. As honey is a must-have item for each local household, there are always plenty of buyers. So, in order to meet current market demand and earn more money, she needs more colonies of bees. To make this possible, she is requesting a loan from SEF International to buy 21 new colonies.  The loan is very important for Araqsya because it will help her give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy twenty-one bee colonies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy refreshments for her bar

loans.name: Elari

texts.en:
Elari is divorced, 49 years old and has five children who are still attending different schools. He lives in Nakatoogo village with his children.
Elari is a businessman who deals in the cereal trade and he works six days in a week,12 hours every day. He is also a farmer who grows coffee.
He has been in the cereal trade since 2001. He started this business in order to get money to support his family and it’s easy to monitor. He also deals in direct agriculture.
He has acquired this loan to boost his cereal business. He sells his products to traders from Kampala and Kyotera.
He hopes to grow the business to a large scale in years to come. His major challenge is the problem of price fluctuations with cereal. 
He describes himself as a hard-working man and asks lenders to continue helping their clients have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Akhuryan village of Shirak region, which was affected by the devastating earthquake in 1988. People of Shirak region have been largely affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive. Locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some land cultivation.
Emma lives with her son and daughter and is involved in land cultivation. She cultivates wheat and potatoes and sells the gathered harvest locally.
As agriculture is the main source of Emma's income, she would like to expand her business.
She has applied to SEF International for the loan to purchase two tonnes of potatoes for selling. She plans to keep it and sell during the winter at good prices.
The loan is important for Emma to gather income and be able to provide better life for her children.

loans.use: to pay for two tonnes of potatoes for selling

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is single mother of one child from Kapan town. She works at a local company and gets a small salary which is hardly enough for covering her and her son's daily costs.
To be financially more secure, Nune started an agricultural business some years ago. For a start she already has a cow and a calf. She milks cows and gets dairy products. Her son helps Nune to sell the gathered products locally.
Realizing that agriculture helps her to have stable income during the month, Nune would like to expand her business.
She has requested a loan from SEF International to purchase a cow and a calf. This will enable her to get more milk and milk products and will significantly increase the sales.
Nune hopes that the loan is a good start for her to expand her agricultural business and she dreams of having a big farm in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael describes himself as a focused father. He is applying for a loan of KES 60,000 through SMEP DTM and has a successful loan repayment history of KES 30,000. Challenges he faces include second-hand clothes in the market. He sees himself in five years having employed workers to help in sewing more clothes and dispatching to his area of Kisumu.

loans.use: to repair and sew new clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is single and operates a store where she sells cereals such as maize, green grams, beans and more. She has been involved in this business for seven years and does her selling in a high-traffic area where many customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use this Kes 60,000 loan, which is her first, to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир родился в городе Душанбе в столице Таджикистана. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и является отцом трехлетнего сына и четырехмесячной дочки. Его жена не работает, так как дети маленькие, а родители уже пенсионеры. В семье Зоир единственный кормилец. У Зоира среднее техническое образование. Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги по перевозке пассажиров на своей автомашине "Starex Hyundai". Он работает шофером уже три года. Зоир запрашивает кредит для ремонта своей автомашины и установки в ней газооборудования.
texts.en: Zoir was born in the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. He is 28 years old. He is married and has a 3-year old son and a 4-month old daughter. His wife stays at home because their children are still young. His parents are already retired. Zoir is the only breadwinner in his family. He has finished technical college. He makes a living transporting passengers in his Starex Hyundai car. He has been working as a driver for three years. Zoir is requesting a loan to repair his car and convert it to natural gas.

loans.use: to repair his car and convert it to natural gas.

loans.name: Jecintah

texts.en: Jecintah is a dairy farmer and plans to use this loan to buy animal feed such as dairy meal for her cows because this will increase their milk production. Her main challenge is a lack of funds to be an effective dairy farmer. Jecintah is very goal oriented and focused on her work, and hopes to buy more cows in the future so that she can sell more milk and improve her standard of living. Farming is her sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for a herd of cows.

loans.name: Hrazdan

texts.en: Hrazdan lives with his wife and works for a local company as a driver. He is also a farmer who raises peaches, apricots, nuts and other crops. and has a herd of animals that includes a cow, a calf and 12 chickens. He gathers his harvest and sells it locally. Hrazdan has applied to SEF International for a loan to buy a cow, fertilizer, and fuel to transport his harvest to the market. He needs this loan to expand his agricultural business and earn more money, which he will use to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizer and fuel.

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto 21 años de edad casado con un hijo de nueve meses de edad, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado al occidente del país, una zona donde el predomina todo tipo de negocio, es una zona muy productiva, Ernesto se caracteriza por ser un hombre responsable muy trabajador, desafortunadamente no pudo culminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos en su hogar y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para aportar en los gastos del hogar, ahora él tiene una familia la cual lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro a su pequeño bebe, gracias a su empeño y espíritu luchador de salir adelante tiene el negocio de mercadería en general específicamente una línea de cortero, el cual consiste en la venta de productos varios, como plásticos, ropa, juguetes de niños, chinerías, cosméticos, prendas de oro, adornos, él tiene clientes fijos y eventuales todos sus productos los tiene regados por varios municipios de Chinandega el cual distribuye y recupera semanal y quincenalmente, actividad que desempeña de forma ambulante y por encargos, su rutina de trabajo de este hombre es de unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a nuevos clientes, el con mucho gusto desempeña este noble trabajo que le da el sustento en su hogar. El objetivo de este crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y de surtir en su negocio y así brindarles mejores artículos a sus clientes fijos, eventuales y posibles clientes para asi en un futuro pueda obtener mejores ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 21, is married and has a nine-month-old son.  He's from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, an area that has all types of businesses.  It's a very productive region.

Ernesto's known for being a responsible and very hardworking man.  Unfortunately he wasn't able to finish his studies because he lacked the resources at home and he needed to work to help pay the household expenses.  Now he has a family and he strives every day to give his little baby a future.

Thanks to his effort and fighting spirit for getting ahead, he has a business selling a variety of merchandise.  Specifically he has a sales route and sells a variety of products such as plastic products, clothing, children's toys, knick-knacks, cosmetics, gold jewelry, and decorations.  He has steady and occasional customers.

He distributes his products through various towns of Chinandega and collects payment for them weekly and biweekly.  He carries out his work as a traveling salesman and on order.  This man's work routine is some 10 hours a day selling his products to new customers.  He carries out this noble job that supports his household with great pleasure.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business.  This way he can offer better products to his steady, occasional, and potential customers and earn a better income for his household.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, knick-knacks, plastic products, clothing, toys, and other merchandise

loans.name: Elbia Yessenia

texts.es:
La  señora Elvia de 38 años de edad  vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años de edad en su casa de habitación, se dedica ala elaboración y venta de conserva, su pequeña micro empresa la tiene ubicada en su casa donde elabora conservas de cocó y de leche.
Doña Elvia cada día después de elaborar su producto sale en su vehículo  a dejar los pedidos que le hacen las pulperías, además de las pulperías también cuenta como clientes todas las glorietas de las escuelas y colegios  de su municipio.
 Doña Elvia solo llega hacer las entrega, además de elaborara conservas, también hace costuras, donde elabora, blusas y uniformes para colegíos, vestidos para damas y niñas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años.
Doña Elvia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de azúcar, cocos, leche,  dulce y leña para la elaboración de sus dulces,  con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Doña Elvia su sueño es  crecer más en su negocio y en clientes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Marzo  del 2013.
texts.en:
Elbia, age 38, lives in her house with her husband and her four year old son.  She makes and sells candy.  Her small business is located in her house, which is where she makes candy from coconut and milk.

Every day after making her product, Elbia goes out in her vehicle to deliver the orders made from the grocery stores.  In addition to the grocery stores, she also has all of the school food stands and students in her municipality as customers.

In addition to making the candy, Elbia delivers it by herself.  She also sews, and she makes blouses and school uniforms and dresses for women and girls.  She has been doing this business activity for four years.

Elbia is requesting to loan to buy sugar, coconuts, sweets, and firewood to make her candy.  With the profits and the support from this loan she wishes to get ahead and to continue improving her business.

Elbia’s dream is to grow more in her business and to have more customers.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconuts, sweets, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  una pulpería  que tiene desde hace más de 3 años.
Doña Francisca con  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, refrescos, carnes, café,  azúcar,  frijoles, pan, arroz, churros, aguas y plátanos. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercadería  que ofrecer y así atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Doña  Francisca  espera cubrir sus necesidades  y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Francisca en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en un mini súper, también espera tener muy buena salud para apoyar sus hijos   en los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca is a responsible, hardworking, honest person. She lives with her spouse and their 2 children in southern Honduras. She has had a small grocery store for more than 3 years.

Mrs. Francisca needs this loan to buy corn, soft drinks, meat, coffee, sugar, beans, bread, rice, churros, water, and bananas. With the loan, she hopes her business’s sales will increase to allow her to offer more merchandise and therefore take better care of her clients.  
Mrs. Francisca hopes to provide for her family's needs and improve their quality of life.

Mrs. Francisca hopes her business will continue to grow and become a mini supermarket. She also hopes for good health, and to be able to support her children in their studies and help them become good people with better opportunities. 

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, soft drinks, meat, coffee, sugar, beans, bread, rice, churros, water, and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Salvard village of Synuiq region. This region is famous for its severe cold climate and locals here are mostly engaged in cattle breeding and some land cultivation.

Gohar lives with her husband and daughter, who is 23 years old, and teaches at a local school. But, unfortunately, her teacher's salary isn't enough to sustain the family, so Gohar is involved in an agricultural business.

She keeps 12 colonies of bees, cultivates barley and potato, as well as growing nut, apple and pear trees. Gohar's husband helps her to gather the harvest and sell it locally. But as it is very difficult for them to cover the family's basic costs, Gohar needs financial support for covering cultivation costs.

She has applied to SEF International to purchase seeds and fertilizer and fuel for taking the gathered harvest to the market. The loan will ease her problems and will help Gohar to continue her agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of land and fuel for taking the gathered harvest to the market

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 54-year-old married woman with 6 children. She is a focused woman and concerned with providing her family with readily available clean water. Her loan will be used to purchase tanks for harvesting water for her area in Nakuru. Her biggest challenge in the Mwea area is an inadequate supply of clean water. This is her first loan through SMEP DTM of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). A family of 8 will benefit from the project.

loans.use: To purchase tanks for water harvesting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Santos Isabela

texts.es:
La señora Santos de 52 años de edad es madre soltera,  y sus hijos no dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, no  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de ropa interior, ropa usada, plásticos y cosméticos.
Doña Santos sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos que  visita a diario, su venta es de manera ambulante, es una mujer sola que lucha día a día para sacar adelante  su casa y su familia.
Doña Santos está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa interior como ser blúmeres, calzoncillos, braseares   pantalones, camisas, faldas y plásticos que es su otro negocio. Por los momentos tiene poco producto y la demanda es bastante fuerte y desea invertir para así lograr tener mejores utilidades y por ende mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Doña Santos está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es tener una casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old and a single mother. Her children do not depend on her. She lives in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She does not have her own house. For three years, she has sold undergarments, used clothing, plastics and cosmetics. 
Santos customers are her friends and neighbors who she visits daily. Her sales are done by delivery. She is a single woman who fights every day to make progress on her house and for her family.
Santos is requesting a loan to purchase undergarments like underwear, bras, shirts, skirts and plastic items for her other business. At the moment, she doesn’t have a lot of products and the demand is strong. She wants to invest in order to have better profits and improve her quality of life a little. 
Santos is happy to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to own a home.

loans.use: purchase plates, cups, dishes, plates, undergarments and clothing for her businesses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 16 years. She describes herself as talkative. She operates a grocery store where she sells groceries like cabbages, tomatoes and bananas. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a densely populated area where customers are plentiful. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 10,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to to buy more cabbages and potatoes to sell. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to graduate level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is involved in agriculture. He cultivates tomatoes and grows apricot and nut trees. He works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it locally. Together with agriculture Hovhannes also works at local company as a watcher. Unfortunately his salary is hardly enough for sustaining his family of 5: Hovhannes himself, his mother, wife and two daughters.

As agriculture helps Hovhannes to have a stable income, he would like to expand his business. He has applied for this loan from SEF International to purchase fertilizer and cover cultivation costs.

As the cultivation process for spring has already started, Hovhannes needs financial support to cover costs. This is very important for him to gather a good harvest and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.ru: Хакимчон 22-х летний молодой человек. Он еще не завел семью. Хакимчон живет с родителями в городе Душанбе. У него среднее образование. Хакимчон ответственный и самостоятельный молодой человек. Он с 19 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он развозит пассажиров внутри города по проспекту Рудаки. Хакимчон работает шофером уже 2,5 года. Он нуждается в кредите для оплаты оставшейся суммы своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Hakimjon is a young, 22 year old man. He is single. Hakimjon lives with his parents in Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. He has a high school degree. Hakimjon is a responsible and independent young man and has been working as a taxi driver since he was 19 years old. He transports passengers inside the city along the Rudaki route. Hakimjon has worked as a driver for 2.5 years. He is requesting this loan to pay off the last car payment on his taxi cab.

loans.use: to pay the last payment on his car

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур житель города Вахдат, расположенный в 20 километрах к юго-востоку от столицы. Ему 30 лет. Он с женой живет у родителей. Баходур зарабатывает на жизнь предоставлением услуги такси. Он развозит пассажиров по маршрутной линии город Вахдат-район Яван. В день он делает два рейса. Баходур работает шофером уже три года. Он запрашивает кредит для ремонта своей автомашины, а малую часть кредита он использует для ремонта дома.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in Vahdat, a city located 20 kilometers/12 miles southwest of the capital Dushanbe. He is 30 years old, married and lives with his parents. Bahodur makes a living as a taxi driver. He transports passengers between Vahdat and the Yavan region and can make two trips per day. He has been working as a driver for three years. Bahodur is requesting a loan to repair his taxi cab and is also plans to spend a small portion of this loan to perform repairs on his house.

loans.use: to repair his taxi cab, as well as use a small portion of the loan to repair his house

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Haykavan village, of the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two sons. One of her sons now serves in the army.

Together with her husband, Emma keeps ten cows and cultivates potatoes, which they sell locally. This agricultural income is very important for Emma and her husband to sustain their living.

So, Emma has applied for this loan to enlarge her agricultural activity. The loan will help her to purchase fertilizer, potato seeds, and two calves. This will enable Emma to cultivate more potatoes and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, potato seeds, and two calves.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en: Kibibi is a married woman. She has two children ranging from 12 to 15 years old. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a charcoal business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be getting charcoal during the rainy season. She will use the KES 75,000 loan to purchase iron sheets and a water tank. Her business goal is to construct another house within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and a water tank

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 26-year-old single mother with a two-year-old child. She describes herself as an honest and humble woman. She has a business of poultry keeping in her area of Machakos. She also operates an Mpesa business to earn extra income. The loan will be used to purchase a water tank to harvest water during the rainy season and help her neighbors with clean water for drinking. This is her second loan application through SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en:
Kefaya is a 37-year-old, conservative woman. She asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. 

After she finishes her shift working as a nurse, Kefaya comes back home to take care of her three daughters and a son. Her husband is a tailor who is working on his own machine. 

Kefaya is applying for a loan to buy a few sewing tools and do maintenance on the sewing machine that her husband has, to enhance his business.

loans.use: to buy some sewing tools and do maintenance on her husband's sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is an ambitious woman who has a business selling clothes and is also a farmer. She plans to use the loan to buy a water tank to use to collect water during the rainy season. The project will take two weeks to complete and benefit six family members and many neighbors. She is applying for a loan of KES 21,000. The client faces a lack of sufficient water to drink. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM, the previous loan being KES 20,000, which was repaid fully. Family members and the neighboring community will benefit from the project.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank to harvest rain water.

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf is a 41-year-old, conservative woman. She asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her.

To help her husband in supporting their children, Afaf started selling from home some home products and blankets to neighbors and friends. By word of mouth, her business was getting some promoting, which has increased the demand on some goods. 

Now, she is applying for a loan to buy a new collection of home products, with better quality.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Lamees

texts.en:
Lamees is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a driver.

Lamees bought a few sports machines and kept them at home as a small gym area for her and her female neighbors. Having no gym in the area has helped her business to grow. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more machines and some weights.

loans.use: to buy more sport machines

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 22-year-old single lady. She is a sister of five siblings.

Sarah is a third year student at the university studying gymnastics education. She is applying for a loan to pay for her next semester fees. After graduation, she would like to be an athletics teacher at a school or get more certification to be a coach at a well-known gym.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara is a 30-year-old married lady with one son. Her husband works in two shops, one is a clothing store and the other is an aluminum shop. Tamara, on the other hand, sells shoes at home to friends and neighbors. She is now applying for a youth loan to buy more types of shoes.

loans.use: to buy more types of shoes

loans.name: Sayfuddin

texts.ru: Сайфуддин работает в сфере торговли уже 6 лет. Свой предыдущий кредит он брал для приобретения холодильника и продуктов питания с целью увеличения товарооборота. В данный момент его торговля процветает. Теперь Сайфуддин хочет получить кредит для приобретения двух аппаратов мороженного (фрейзер). Скоро наступит лето, а это уже сезон мороженого. Он надеется заработать на этом бизнесе и за счет его прибыли купить магазин, который он арендует.
texts.en: Sayfuddin has worked in retail for 6 years. He used his previous loan with KIVA to purchase a refrigerator and bulk groceries for his store and improved goods turnover. Currently Sayfuddin's business is booming. Now he want to take out a loan to purchase two soft serve ice cream machines for the coming summer season. Summer season is ice cream season in Tajikistan and Sayfuddin hopes to make a tidy profit selling soft serve ice cream and use the income to buy out the grocery store space he is currently renting.

loans.use: to purchase two soft serve ice cream makers

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшоду 31 год. Он женатый молодой человек. Дилшод с женой живет в доме отца в селе города Вахдат, расположенный в 20 км к юго-востоку от столицы. Вместе с ними также живут его сестра и племянник. У Дилшода среднее образование. Он в возрасте 22 года начал работать в сфере предоставления услуги такси и уже 9 лет как он работает таксистом. Сейчас он хочет расширить свою деятельность. Дилшод накопил половину денег для покупки нового автомобиля, а остальную часть запрашивает в кредит. Он будет заниматься развозкой пассажиров в своем селе.
texts.en: Dilshod is 31 years old and married. He lives with his wife at his father's house in a village near Vahdat, a city 20 km/12 miles southwest of the capital. Dilshod's sister and nephew also live with them. Dilshod has a high school degree and has been working as a taxi driver for 9 years, since he was 22 years old. Now he wants to expand his business. Dilshod has saved enough money to pay for half of the purchasing costs of a new car and is taking out this loan to pay for the other half. He is planning to provide transportation services within his village.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his taxi business

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru:
Бактыгул 44 года, воспитывает сына. Бактыгул работает продавцом в магазине и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав этот бизнес 10 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 головы крупного рогатого скота.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для получения доходов от продажи молока.  Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшее время планирует провести ремонт времянки.
texts.en: Baktygul is 44, and has a son. She works as a salesperson in a store. As a second source of income for her family, she is also involved in animal husbandry. She started this business 10 years ago with 15,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Baktygnul now has 2 head of cattle in her business. With the goal of expanding her business, Baktygnul has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners Microlending Bank for a loan in the amount of 30,000 soms (KGS) to buy cattle and earn income from selling the milk. Baktygnul plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into further augmenting her animal herd, and also in the near future plans to do some makeshift repairs.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en: Kholoud is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two sons. Her husband is a farmer while she sells clothes at home. Now Kholoud is applying for a loan to buy a new collection of clothing items.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.ru: Бекназар 1982 года рождения, он женат и имеет троих детей. Бекназар    проживает вместе семьей в городе. Более 2 лет он занимается перевозкой людей по транспортной линии. Рабочее время  Бекназара  начинает с 06:00 по 20:00 вечера, количество рабочих дней 28дней в месяц.  Он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Он работает усиленно для получения больше дохода для обеспечения большой семьи. Он планирует купить новую маршрутку марки « Хундай Старекс». Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки маршрутки. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Beknazar was born in 1982, he is married and has three children. Beknazar lives with his family in Dushanbe. He has been offering shuttle services for more then two years. Beknazar works from 6 am to 8 pm, 28 days a months and is the main provider for his family. He works extra hard to earn more money for his large family. Beknazar is planning to buy a new shuttle bus of the "Hyundai Starex" brand. He is requesting a loan of 1500 US dollars to purchase the shuttle bus. Beknazar awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus for developing his business

loans.name: Gulbaira

texts.ru:
Гулбайра – участник группы «Бек - Бол», ей 43 года,имеет 5 детей. Гулбайра в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством.
В целях развития своего бизнеса, Гулбайра обратилась в банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 1 бычка и закуп ГСМ на весеннее – полевые работы.  Доходы от кредита Гулбайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, в ближайшее время планирует сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Gulbaira is a member of the "Bek-Bol" group. She is 43 years old and has five children. Gulbaira helps provide for her family by raising livestock and farming. In order to expand her business Gulbaira has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). She plans to purchase a young bull for her herd and also fuel for spring planting. Gulbaira will use the profits from this loan to further expand her herd and hopes to repair her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and fuel

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 20-year-old married lady. Her husband is a blacksmith and they have no kids yet.
 
To help enhance their living conditions and to fill up her free time, Samar sells blankets and a few home products at home to friends and neighbors. She now wants to enhance her business and bring in new collection of home products. For that reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 48-year-old conservative lady who asked her husband to appear in the photo. Khadija is a governmental employee working to help her husband in supporting their six sons and daughters. Her husband, on the other hand, sells sheep for a living. Now Khadija wants to support her husband's business by increasing the number of sheep they have.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 25 лет. Он холост и живет с родителями. Умедчон более 4 года работает в магазине продавцом. Его основной доход является уго зарплата, так как он не имеет бизнес. Его дом имеет плохое состояние и поэтому он хочет отремонтировать его. Первую очередь он хочет отремонтировать двор дома. Он планирует сделать стяжку, но не имеет денег для покупки цемента, песка и другого не обходимого строй - материала. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему улучшить условию проживания. Он как добросовестный человек погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Umedjon is a young and energetic man. He is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents. Umedjon has worked as a store clerk for four years. His salary is his main source of income, as he has no business of his own. Umedjon's house is in a shabby state and he wants to perform repairs. He wants to repair the house's courtyard first. Umedjon is planning to pour new concrete floor, but has no money to purchase cement, sand and other supplies. Umedjob is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars and awaits your kindness. This loan will help him improve his living conditions. Umedjon is a responsible man who will pay off the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house repairs

loans.name: Zakhira

texts.ru:
Захира – участник группы «Бек - Бол», ей 40 лет,  имеет 3 детей. Захира в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством.
В целях развития своего бизнеса, Захира обратилась в банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 20 овец и закуп ГСМ на весеннее – полевые работы.  Доходы от кредита Захира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zakhira is a member of the "Bek-Bol" group. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. Zakhira supports her family by raising livestock and farming. In order to expand her business Zakhira has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS). She plans to purchase 20 sheep and diesel fuel for the planting season. Zakhira will use the profits from this loan to expand her herd.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and fuel

loans.name: Batmakan

texts.ru:
Батмакан  51 год, воспитывает 2 детей. Батмакан в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав после распада Советского Союза с суммы (KGS) 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Батмакан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 3,7 га земли с картошкой и многолетними травами.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батмакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого скота и ядохимикатов для обработки земли.  Доходы от кредита Батмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а  также начать копить на контракт на обучение для детей.
texts.en: Batmakan is 51 and has two children. She earns a living for her family through animal husbandry. She started out after the breakup of the Soviet Union with 10,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Batmakan's farm now has 2 head of cattle with calves, and 3.7 hectares of land planted in potatoes and perennial grasses. With the goal of expanding her business, Batmakan has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners Microlending Bank for a loan in the amount of 55,000 soms (KGS) to buy a sheep and pesticides to apply to the soil. Batmakan plans to invest the proceeds gained from the loan into further augmenting her number of livestock, as well as to save up for the children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep and pesticides

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Его зовут Рустамчон. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. В течение многих лет он занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культуры. У него 8  коровы и  12 барана. У него 10 га земли, где выращивает зерновые культуры. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  14000  сомони для покупки скота и минерального удобрения, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A man with a generous soul and a kind heart needs your help as he has found himself in financial difficulties. His name is Rustamjon. He is married and has four children. The climate in his region allows for farming and raising livestock and Rustamjon has been farming for many years. He has a herd of 8 cows and 12 sheep and 10 hectares of land where he grows cereals. Rustamjon sells livestock for meat after fattening the animals for a few months. He has many regular clients at the local livestock market. Rustamjon wants to expand his business but he has no savings. He is requesting a loan of 14000 somoni to purchase cattle and fertilizer. He is planning to use the profits from this loan to provide his children with good education and modern electronics. Rustamjon awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 24-year-old single guy. He has three younger siblings. Mohammad is a university student majoring in economics. He is applying for an educational loan to help him pay the semester fees on time.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 31-year-old divorced man. During the day time, he works as a cashier. After that he goes to work at his own small shop, where he sells a few types of hot drinks. He is now applying for a loan to add a refrigerator to his shop so he can serve cold drinks soon in the summer.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 56-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 6 sons and daughters. Her husband is a farmer, while she sells clothes at home. Now Maryam is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has of clothes to sell and get new spring collection.

loans.use: to get a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор очень опытный бизнес мен. Более 10 лет он занимается купле продажей муки. Он имеет торговую точку на местном рынке. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов, так как он продает высококачественный товар. Абдугафор упорно трудится, для того, чтобы обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети еще маленькие. Его жена домохозяйка, так как недавно у них родился сын. Абдугафор запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки муки, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получать больше дохода. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Он обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Abdugafor is an experienced business man. He has been re-selling flour for 10 years. Abdugafor has his own stall at the local market and regular clients as he sells only high quality product. Abdugafor is determined to work hard so that he can provide his family with all the necessities. He is married and is raising three young children. Abdugafor's wife stays at home as they have a newborn son. Abdugafor is requesting a loan of 7500 somoni to purchase flour in bulk and have more working capital on hand, which will allow him to have higher profits. He hopes for your kindness and charity. Abdugafor promises to pay off the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy flour and increase working capital

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal was able to participate in some exhibitions for embroidered items, which has helped in promoting her work. She is now applying for another loan to buy a few missing tools to enhance her embroidery business. She also wants to start making new items, such as embroidered frames.

loans.use: to buy new embroidery tools.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Kiteredde with his family. He has 4 children:  the youngest is 5 years old, while the oldest is 16. He is involved in agriculture and deals in both animals and food crops.

He currently needs some money to buy manure for his gardens. He also hopes to buy a few more cows. His major challenge is competition and the price fluctuations in the market.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
La Joven  Edis  de 21 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres y se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio  que es un mercadito donde vende lo que es todo en abarrotería, vende refrescos, embutidos y todo en granos básicos.
Edis está solicitando el crédito para compra de mercadería como lociones, perfumes, cremas, carteras, aretes, pulseras, etc. para damas  siendo este su segundo negocio donde pondrá a la venta este tipo de productos,   sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos  de su barrio y de otros barrios cercanos,.
Edis  espera que con esta inversión que realice a su negocio mejore un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia desea seguir mejorando su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es abrir otro negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Marzo del 2013.
texts.en:
Edis is a 21-year-old young woman. She is single and lives with her parents. She has had her business for five years, a small market where she sells all kinds of groceries, soft drinks, cold cuts, and all basic grains. 

Edis is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise like women's lotions, fragrances, creams, purses, earrings, bracelets, etc. This is her second business, where she will sell this type of products. Her customers ar all the friends and neighbors from her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. 

Edis expects to somewhat improve her and her family's quality of life through this investment in her business. She wishes to keep improving her business and offer her customers better service.

Her dream is to open another business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2013.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, fragrances, creams, purses, earrings, bracelets, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Manik

texts.en:
Manik is from Aygeshat village of the Armavir region, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and son.

Manik is engaged in land cultivation. Particularly, she cultivates tomatoes, onions, and melons, and grows cherry trees. Manik's husband sells the gathered harvest locally and gathers income, which is the only income for family.

It is very difficult for Manik and her husband to sustain the family and the agricultural income is very important to them. They own an greenhouse that is too old and needs to be renovated, but unfortunately Manik and her husband have no financial funds for doing the renovation. Manik has requested this loan from SEF International to renovate her old greenhouse and purchase fertilizer for the cultivation of her crops.

The loan will enable this family to cultivate fruits and vegetables in new greenhouse and gather higher income. Manik dreams to give her family appropriate living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and to cover the renovation costs of her greenhouse.

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru: Эмомали житель города Дангара, расположенный в южной части страны. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него две дочери и два сына, которые учатся в школе. Эмомали занимается торговым бизнесом. На рынке города у него имеется собственный магазин, где он продает различные виды посуд. Он занимается этим бизнесом вот уже 10 лет. Эмомали очень опытный торговец, так как он обслуживает своих клиентов вежливо и доброжелательно. Кредит запрашивает для приобретения ассортимента товара (посуды) с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Emomali lives in Dangara in southern Takjikistan. He is 39 years old, married and has two sons and two daughters who are all attending school. Emomali has worked in retail for 10 years and has his own kitchenware store at the local market. He is an experienced salesman and so is always polite and friendly with his clients. Emomali is requesting this loan to purchase more inventory for his store and so expand the variety of goods his store offers which is key to increasing goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory (dishes) for the purpose of increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 19-year-old single lady. She has seven siblings. Being in a big family increases the financial pressure on the parents, especially when they want all of their children to get a better education. Iman is a second-year student at the university. She is applying for an educational loan to help her pay for the next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbaatar, 38 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for two years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, shortening roads and delivering them quickly. Eight months ago, he and his wife began running a grocery store as an additional income source. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase foodstuffs in large quantity from the supplier. As a result, he and his wife can run their grocery store continually without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who greatly cares for his family.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs in large quantity

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Tahmina. She is widowed and has two children, aged 17 and 18. Her husband died in a car accident. To provice for their household, Tahmina established her sewing services business about 12 years ago.  Her business is located in her house, and her main customers are women. She works 7 days a week and 10 hours a day. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She plans to build a little room in the yard of her house to make it a sewing studio. Tahmina hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies.

Tahmina would like to apply for a loan of 700 AZN manat, to buy additional supplies of tailoring materials like fabric, needles, thread and other accessories needed in her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of tailoring materials like fabric, needles, thread and other accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
Nilfa works hard to support her family. Nilfa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Nilfa has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Nilfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Gilbert from Harare, the capital city of Zimbabwe. He is married with three children, two attending school. He also cares for one dependent. 

Gilbert runs a service business where he prints batik materials. The business has been in operation for three years. He says the main challenge faced is lack of adequate capital to meet the increased demand. 

Gilbert has requested a loan of USD 750 to buy more printing materials to meet pending orders. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Gilbert plans to own a printing company.

loans.use: to buy more printing materials for his business.

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Бобомуроду 46 лет. Он женат и является отцом двоих детей. Его дочь учится в школе, а сын еще маленький. Бобомурод со своей семьей живет в южной части Таджикистана в городе Дангара. Он предприимчивый, честный человек. Бобомурод работает в сфере торговли в течение 9 лет. Рядом с домом у него имеется небольшой магазин, в котором он занимается продажей продуктов питания, в частности конфеты, печенье, рулеты, чай, сахар, масло и т.д. и хозяйственных товаров. Бобомурод запрашивает кредит для закупа ассортимента товара с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Bobomurod is 46 years old. He is married and has two children. Hie daughter attends school and his son is still a toddler. Bobomurod lives with his family in southern Tajikistan in Dangara. He is an entrepreneur and an honest man. Bobomurod has worked in retail for 9 years and manages a grocery store close to his home. His grocery store sells candy, cookies, rolls, tea, sugar, butter as well as household items.
