This young lady is a teacher at an elementary school in the city of Condega, where she works Monday through Friday, from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon.  In the afternoods she plans her classes for the next day and on weekends sells beauty products by catalogue to make extra income.

This borrower came to the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to buy construction materials to renovate her house.  She is planning to buy zinc metal sheeting for maintenance of her roof, as well as cement for the walls of her house.  She will also hire workers to do the job.

It is worth mentioning that this is her fourth loan and she is requesting it because her monthly income is not enough to cover the full renovation cost.  She hopes the loan will be approved because the rainy season is approaching and she wants to have her house ready by then.  She is very grateful to Ceprodel because the previous loan also helped with her home renovation so she could have a decent roof over her head.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and cement, and to hire workers to renovate her house.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio vive en la cuidad de Managua casado trabaja en el área de mantenimiento en un centro de compra  de la capital desde hace 20 años.

Muy responsable en sus tarea laborales, Silvio está solicitando un crédito para hacerles  un anexo en su casa para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Agradece mucho a kiva y ceprodel por que los créditos que le han otorgado los ha utilizado para mejorar poco a poco su casa
texts.en:
Silvio lives in the city of Managua.  He is married and has been working in the maintenance area of a shopping center in the capital city for over 20 years.

Silvio, who is very responsible in his work, is requesting a loan to expand his house to improve living conditions.

He is very grateful for Kiva and Ceprodel for the loans he has received and used to renovate his house little by little.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This marks Emily's fourth loan to purchase poultry mash and chicks for rearing in her increased chicken brood. 

She has previously serviced her loans well and is very hopeful that she will continue to get funds for her poultry farm at any time from KADET. 

She hopes to increase her supply of chicks further to be able to satisfy her clients and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase poultry mash and chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is 35 years old and a resident of Kasubi located in the suburbs of the city. He has four children, who all attend school. He dropped out of school at the secondary level due to a lack of school fees and then started running small businesses.

Tadeo deals in the business of jewellery and other small items, which he started in 2008 with the aim of improving his daily income and through this has been able to take care of himself and his family. However, his business could not grow due to a lack of capital. 

He would like to get a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to add more stock to his business and enable him to expand and meet all the client's demands.

Tadeo’s dream is to expand his business and even to be able to sell on a wholesale basis. He would also like to get a shop, where he can stage his business and stop selling from the veranda. He also wants to finish his residential house.

Tadeo faces the difficulty of inadequate capital and competition also affects him. He is such a hard working man and he is very committed to his business.

He thanks UGAFODE for giving him support towards fulfilling his dreams.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 34-year-old mother of three girls and a boy. Her husband already works in two jobs to make a living. 

Fatmeh has started to help too by opening a small store selling food products and sometimes home products. 

Now, she is applying for a loan to bring more goods to her store and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to bring more goods to her store

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a 46-year-old mother of one daughter. She lives in Yerevan with her husband and 18-year-old daughter, who studies at Yerevan State University in the Department of Management.

Gohar is a seller at a local shop and, together with her husband, she works hard to gather income and sustain her family. 

Unfortunately, it is very difficult for Gohar to cover the family's costs and at the same time save money for her daughter’s education. So, Gohar has requested this loan from SEF International to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

The loan is very important for this whole family. Gohar dreams that daughter will become a good specialist and be financially independent in the future.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 30 years old. He lives in a small village in the Ozurgeti District with his parents. 

Lasha has requested several loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request has been rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. Specifically, they have two milking cows, two calves and two pigs. Besides this, they have ten beehives with bee colonies and a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees and maize are grown. They sell the harvested products, like honey and cheese, at the local markets. 

Lasha has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Lasha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Lasha will purchase a festive tent and all the equipment needed, which can be used at different kinds of events. He will rent it out to the other villagers and generate income. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a festive tent to rent out
